column4: Anyone? Here is the problem: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=643092
Please describe the problem not just post a link

Sorry, Basically I'm trying to get multiple monitors set up(using twin view from the sound of it) on my 7900GS(nvidia card), however the screen and graphics window seems to think I have 2 Syncmaster 205BW s when I have 1 of them and a Dell M782p when I change it and restart X it just resets the settings, plus it doesn't even display the correct resolution options, and I think...
I dont use dual monitors.. you are not trying to get different res's on each one are you?
Yeah, I am one should be running 1680*1050(samsung) and the dell should be at 1280*1024 my understanding was that twin view should be able to do this
someone else may know, but I was not aware that you could do that.. not that I have tried
Hopefully you can, I was doing it under windows :P
This aint windows
No it ain't, and I like everything better except setting up X
Once you get it set you will love it.. but yes, requires more work but allows more flexibility that MS
When I try to run sudo nvidia-settings it just tells me that nvidia x isn't running, even though xorg.conf lists the driver as nvidia
Did you try using the hoary version?
No I haven't, right now I'm using gnash which doesn't work too well, how would I install it?
The workaround is to first go to synaptic, select the flashplugin-nonfree package and then mark it for *complete* removal.
Then install the hardy flashplugin,  http://launchpadlibrarian.net/10761023/flashplugin-nonfree_9.0.115.0ubuntu2_i386.deb
Will that work on an amd64 system?
I honestly dont know...
There would possibly be a different dl from hoary
How would I force the package to work with amd64(right now it gives me an architecture error)?
I dont know
Alright, I'll just wait it out then, so there is no estimate?
I am sure lots of people are working onit
